newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK CPI (A) rises annual 6.1 pct in July.
newsitem.headline: HK CPI (A) rises annual 6.1 pct in July.

text.p: The Census and Statistics Department released the following consumer price index data showing Hong Kong's CPI (A) rose 6.1 percent in July year-on-year, according to the 1994/95-based series.
The June 1996 comparison is calculated according to a revised set of figures following the Hong Kong government's rebasing of consumer price indices in April.

CPI (A) is based on the 50 percent of households spending HK$2,500-$9,999 a month as of the 1989/90 fiscal year base and CPI (B) covers the 30 percent which spent HK$10,000-$17,499.
